body.name: TYPE S TOURING ITEMS S1 HD Car Dash Cam 1080P (True 720P) Front Car Cam Dashcam with Built-in G-Sensor, 30 FPS Recording, Easy Installation, 4GB Micro SD Card Included Dash Camera

byLineInfo.name: Visit the TYPE S TOURING ITEMS Store

deliveryMessages: Or fastest delivery Tuesday, February 20. Order within 5 mins
features: [Extra Security] The Type S HD dashcam is your vehicle's extra layer of protection; it captures everything during your drive in 1080P (True 720P) at 30 FPS. Record accidents with superb clarity and hold every party involved accountable. Capture all the interesting sights you see during your drive without having to rubberneck or take out our phone.

[110° Viewing Angle] With its 110° wide angle lens, the Type S dashboard camera will cover the entirety of the road in front of your vehicle. Paired with the HD resolution, the Type S camera ensures that every single detail evidence such as license plates and roadblocks... are captured with perfect clarity, day or night, just in case you need them.

[Seamless Installation] It doesn't require an expert to install this HD dash camera. All you need to do is connect it to your 12/24V outlet, route & hide the cable along the passenger side frame and A-pillar, and you'd be good to go. The camera will automatically turn on & off with your vehicle without draining the car battery.

[Built-in G-Sensor] When accidents or collisions happen, the G-Sensor will automatically save, lock and move the video to a different folder so it doesn't get overwritten by loop record. You'll still be able to access the incident footage even months later in case you need them as evidence for insurance claims.

[Park & Record] Couldn’t find the person who gave your car a huge dent while you were away? No worries, the Type S HD car cam has got you covered; when hardwired (kit sold separately), the cam automatically wakes & records incidents when it detects collision… even when the vehicle is not in use, helping you find the person responsible in no time.

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: Video Resolution: FHD 1080P (1920*1080) at 30 FPS, 720P (1280*720P) at 30 FPS, VGA (640*480P) Video Format: AVI/MJGPG Max Photo Resolution: 12M View Angle: D = 110°, H = 94.5°, V = 52° Memory Capacity: 32GB (4GB memory card included) Interface: Mini USB Camera Input Rating: 400mA, 5V 0.4A Battery mAh: Li-ion, 3.7V, 180mAh, 0.666Wh

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 25, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Good small size. Stays mounted easily.
reviews.reviewText: This isn't a bad dash cam. It is by no means crystal clear or the best one out there (720P model), but it's proficient for a basic dashcam. The suction cup mount has been good. I've had no issue with it falling off or coming loose, so I like that it stays in one position securely. What's nice is that it turns on and off with you car when connected to a 12v power source or usb port. I prefer to keep the cable hidden, so you may have to some maneuvering to cover it up, but the cable is long. Picture quality is basic and not the clearest at times, but it's enough to provide some peace of mind in most situations. Only short duration recording times, so I can't see how a bigger SD card would make a difference if it just loops after 5 minutes.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 25, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars Good camera bad charger
reviews.reviewText: Car charger stopped working after 1 day. Camera itself not bad, compact and easy to install and use

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 10, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars easy to use
reviews.reviewText: This cam is easy to hook up and use. Comes with small SD card, so you'll want to get a 32GB card. The video quality is pretty low res by today's standards but decent enough for capturing your drive and any events happening to the front of the car. Has enough wire to run through channels. to the top of the windshield mirror area.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 11, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars 2 SD cards and still does not work
reviews.reviewText: The card that came with did not work and bought a new that it says to use and it doesn’t work either. All directions have been followed and it did not help.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 18, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 2.0 out of 5 stars Easy setup, poor functionality
reviews.reviewText: The media could not be loaded. I’ll start with with good stuff first. Setup and installation was a breeze. It only took a couple of minutes to set up date/time, license plate number and recording resolution. The camera does require constant power via a cigarette lighter, not just a battery charge. I was concerned that the cord wouldn’t be long enough and that it would be an eye sore. Im happy to report that routing the cable only took about 10 minutes. You can see it where it plugs into the camera and at the other end into the cigarette lighter outlet. I was easily able to get it under the mirror cover, headliner, down the A-pillar, through the paneling, glove box and the center console. The few pics are included are to illustrate this point, not just random pics of car angles. The camera mounts firmly, without any movement, slippage or dismount. I like how easy it is to unplug, then slide the camera for easy removal. It’s great that a micro USB card is included. It may be small at only 4GB, but it will get you going right out of the box, with the ability to upgrade to a 32GB of storage. Im impressed with the large field of view, capturing everything in sight. It’s actually larger than what is show in my video, because I cropped the bottom out to remove the license plate number.Unfortunately, that’s where the positives stop. I recorded at 1920x1080, or what is commonly known as Full HD. The video is grainy and jittery. You can see in my video the Camaro that passes me on the right has a glitchy motion. It candle handle any amount of glare. I was unable to use anything where I was driving into the sun. Even driving away from the sun, you can NOT see that the license plate on the car in front of me. It was only a matter of a few feet and stopped at a light. Audio is cheap. This one recorded without sound altogether, but that was most likely me hitting something in the settings, because it does have audio. i also experienced several recording failures. The camera can be removed from your vehicle and plugged into a computers USB port for file transfer. 8 out of 28 files were corrupted and would not play. That is the error message pic that I have posted.What does all this add up to? If you’re in an accident you’ll be able to tell what cars were where and who did what, provided they’re within the field of view. Could you make out a license plate? Probably not. If someone vandalized your vehicle, you *might* be able to get a good enough recording for identification. All that IF they video file itself doesn’t fail. As much as I wanted to love this, I do not, nor can I recommend.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 29, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Good to have in this day and age
reviews.reviewText: Everything seems to be working well, we haven’t had to really use it for anything like an accident or what not but it does keep recording and the screen goes blank after 5 minutes so it’s not distracting the driver, which is nice. My only complaint is the instruction manual. It’s could definitely be written in a more user friendly way bc it is a bit confusing. You will need to read and go through it a few times and keep it handy until you’re used to everything on the camera and how to use it. Picture quality is okay, I mean it’s not 4K but it’s also not horrible either. I think it will be fine if the time ever came to have to use it and have evidence. I pray to God I never need it. Worth the money. Easy to install in the car, but you will need to use some kind of tape to keep the wiring up out of the way and ran along the seams of your car to the lighter outlet so there isn’t cord in your way. My husband did a great job hiding the wire for 90% of the cord length but in the picture I posted you can see the one spot he had to use tape. I don’t mind though. The suction power is great and it has stayed on the windshield so far (have had it up about 4 weeks) Overall I think the price is worth it and it gives me peace of mind knowing I have it bc people drive like idiots these days!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 12, 2023
reviews.reviewText: The media could not be loaded. Super easy to set up! I love that it already comes with a Micro SD card inserted, and you can transfer recordings and pictures onto your computer very easily. It stores everything in a gallery and is very easy to navigate. The suction is very firm and I'm confident that it will stay on the glass effectively. It turns on automatically and begins to record when the car ignition is turned over. You can stop recording with a push of a button and turn it off just as easy if you don't want to use it. The view can be changed by rotating the cam, and the resolution is decent. Low price for a good quality dash cam.
